head.title: There's Newark City Hall, Then There Is . . .

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New Jersey

hedline.hl1: There's Newark City Hall, Then There Is . . .

abstract.p: Moses Wilson Jr, owner of strip club Sights, and security head Tyrone Leak say former Deputy Mayor Hector Corchado of Newark, NJ, who left post to run for City Council seat, visited club at least half-dozen times until late last year (S)

block.p: It might be fortunate for former Deputy Mayor Hector Corchado that he left his post last month to run for a seat on the City Council in the May 14 municipal election.

After all, Mayor Sharpe James said that he would dismiss any member of his staff seen in a Newark strip club where 31 people were arrested on prostitution-related charges last month. (Never mind that it later came out that the mayor had also paid a visit.)
It might be fortunate for former Deputy Mayor Hector Corchado that he left his post last month to run for a seat on the City Council in the May 14 municipal election.

After all, Mayor Sharpe James said that he would dismiss any member of his staff seen in a Newark strip club where 31 people were arrested on prostitution-related charges last month. (Never mind that it later came out that the mayor had also paid a visit.)
Moses Wilson Jr., the owner of the club, Sights, and the head of security there, Tyrone Leak, said Mr. Corchado had been to the club at least a half-dozen times until late last year.
Mr. Corchado, who has been on a leave of absence from the mayor's office since last month, did not respond to repeated messages left at his home and campaign headquarters.

The club must have been a pretty popular place. Jermaine James, an aide to Councilman Cory Booker -- who is opposing Mr. James for mayor -- was questioned by the police outside the club during a raid on March 24, though he was not charged.
